stimulus:
In this experiment, you will be presented with 8 scenarios, which you must read carefully.

After reading each scenario, you will be prompted two comprehension questions: a multiple choice question and a brief open answer question. You will be required to answer both questions for every scenario, meaning 16 questions in total.

To begin the experiment, hit the space bar.

response.Explanation: I think that the compliment is very passive aggressive, and Alice is probably quite bitter about Olivia copying her hairstyle.
I think that Jane is genuinely concerned about Catherine and I don't think her message sounds insincere at all - she is worried about her partner.

I think that Anastasia probably didn't want to upset Jack as she knew he'd tried his best despite being a poor cook. She probably wanted to just keep the real reaction to herself without hurting his feelings.
I think Margaret was just giving her true and honest opinion about the dog, and wasn't trying to hide her dislike. She was authentic about her response.

On one hand, I think he could be being sarcastic but I think he is being sincere in that he just wants to make the candidate feel some confidence after the interview and after Philip was so polite and friendly. He kept his opinion to himself and tried to give Philip a bit of a boost.
As mentioned in the text, despite the fights, Jeremy feels generally very positive about his brother and wants to show David that really, he does love his brother.
I would hope that Ana and Ken had spoken about James before, and since he has asked for her real opinion, believes what Ana has said about her ex.
Since Elizabeth probably doesn't know the backstory, she probably did think May was being sincere and that she had had a nice time.
